sentences.text: On 21 December 2023, 14 people were killed and 22 injured in a mass shooting at the main Faculty of Arts, Charles University|Faculty of Arts building of Charles University in central Prague, Czech Republic. Another three people were injured when the perpetrator opened fire toward the streets from the faculty's fourth-floor rooftop terrace. After having been engaged by the police, the perpetrator, 24-year-old postgraduate student David Kozák, committed suicide by shooting himself.

sentences.text: On 15 December 2023, a 32-year-old father and his two-month-old daughter in a stroller were shot dead in {{Interlanguage link|Klánovice Forest|cs|Vražda v Klánovickém lese (2023)}} on the eastern outskirts of Prague, approximately {{convert|25|km}} away from where the later attack would take place at Charles University. Later investigation revealed that the perpetrator David Kozák had only visited the Klánovice Forest once before committing the murders. Kozák carried a brown beige backpack and was armed with two handguns—a Glock|Glock 45 and a Beretta 70|Beretta 71.<ref name=":1" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-europe-67795251?ns_linkname=65849520f825603c1a3808fe%26Prague%20shooter%20connected%20with%20two%20murders%20last%20week%262023-12-21T19%3A47%3A43.915Zpinned_post_locator=urn:asset:563fd8fc-7704-4091-b33d-cfe4bdb9b052 |title=Prague shooter connected with two murders last week |date=21 December 2023 |publisher=BBC News |access-date=21 December 2023 |archive-date=21 December 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231221195537/https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-europe-67795251?ns_linkname=65849520f825603c1a3808fe%26Prague%20shooter%20connected%20with%20two%20murders%20last%20week%262023-12-21T19:47:43.915Zpinned_post_locator=urn:asset:563fd8fc-7704-4091-b33d-cfe4bdb9b052 |url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="idnes-final-report" /> On the day of the Charles University shooting, Kozák had written a suicide note on his computer detailing the Klánovice murders; he had also hidden the murder weapon in the family garden.<ref name="idnes-final-report" /> According to the letter, he used public transport on the day of the murders and switched off his phone while changing transport on the other side of Prague.<ref name="idnes-final-report" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=Hrbáček |first=Jan |date=2024-08-29 |title=Rozstřílel bych kohokoliv, nechci být v rodinné hrobce, napsal vrah z fakulty |url=https://ekonomickydenik.cz/rozstrilel-bych-kohokoliv-nechci-byt-v-rodinne-hrobce-napsal-vrah-z-fakulty/ |access-date=2024-09-28 |work=Ekonomický deník |language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text: The police conducted a detailed search of the entire forest with hundreds of officers, while a special task force was set up in order to find the perpetrator. The police had no direct leads. The scope of investigation was first directed at owners of registered firearms matching the ballistic report from the crime scene, which initially limited the search to about 30,000 people. of which about 40 people lived in direct vicinity of the Klánovice Forest.

references.text: <ref name="idnes-final-report" /> This was then further limited to 4,000,<ref name="bbc4000">{{cite news |title=Czech mass shooting: Gunman confessed to shooting baby in woods |language=cs |website=BBC |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67830858 |date=28 December 2023 |access-date=28 December 2023 |archive-date=28 December 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231228003333/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67830858 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: At an unknown time on 21 December 2023, Kozák's father was shot from behind while sitting at a table. His neck was then laid on a block of wood, and an axe found lying next to him indicated that Kozák intended to Decapitation|cut his father's head off, which he didn't do.<ref name="Echo messages" /><ref name="police knew" />

references.text: <ref name="contraproductive" /> six days after the Klánovice Forest murders, Kozák murdered his father by shooting him three times in the head at their home in Hostouň (Kladno District)|Hostouň, about 9 km (6 mi) west of Prague, with a semi-automatic variant of the Škorpion machine pistol.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kolář |first=Václav Janouš, Petr |date=2024-06-17 |title=Pravda o střelbě na fakultě. sentences.text: At 12:19 CET the Central Bohemian Police received a call from Kozák's mother. One minute later, a friend of Kozák only identified as ''K.C.'' called medical emergency line, stating that Kozák was planning to take his own life. She also said that "he could be dangerous",  At 12:33, the police entered Kozák's home and found the body of his father. A thorough search of the house at this time was hindered by improvised explosive devices, which were decommissioned by specialists later that day. The police discovered that Kozák was a student of the Charles University's Faculty of Arts, Charles University|Faculty of Arts in Prague. A search warrant was issued and published; it indicated that Kozák was armed and dangerous.

sentences.text: At 13:10, the Central Bohemian Police, whose jurisdiction the village of Hostouň falls under, directly alerted the Prague Police. The Prague police dispatcher issued an all-points bulletin (APB) which stated that Kozák was sought due to suicide threats, that he may be dangerous, and that he also may be connected to a violent crime, possibly a murder. A security operation was commenced at Václav Havel Airport Prague near Hostouň, where both Kozák and his father worked. At 13:20, Prague Police checked the Gun law in the Czech Republic#Categories of guns|Central Registry of Firearms, noting that Kozák owns multiple firearms, and that one of them was of the type which was the focus of Klánovice murders investigation. The APB was expanded with information that Kozák should be considered extremely dangerous.

sentences.text: At 13:57, the dispatch sent multiple police units to evacuate the Celetná Street Faculty of Arts building. where they would stand guard until the start of the attack in the main building.<ref name="pol report" /> The Celetná building is a twelve-minute walk from the main building.

references.text: <ref name="Echo APB" /> The six police officers who searched the main building left without taking any further action there and proceeded to the Celetná building,<ref name="Echo police present before">{{Cite web|first=Záviš|last=Dobiašovský|url=https://echo24.cz/a/HLtfQ/zpravy-domaci-strelba-na-filozoficke-fakulte-utok-cinnost-policie-reditel-matejcek|title=Pochybila policie? O nebezpečném muži věděla, fakultu však nevyklidila|website=Echo24|language=cs|date=22 December 2023|access-date=22 December 2023|publisher=Echo Media, a. s.|archive-date=22 December 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231222144956/https://echo24.cz/a/HLtfQ/zpravy-domaci-strelba-na-filozoficke-fakulte-utok-cinnost-policie-reditel-matejcek|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: {{blockquote |''Increased caution for all patrols in the case of this Kozák. He's a really dangerous, very dangerous offender, suspect, and there's a lot of concern that he could use a weapon anytime, anywhere.''}}

sentences.text: The evacuation of Celetná building was finished at 14:22; Kozák was not found in the building or in its vicinity. Dozens of heavily armed police officers, including the Prague SWAT unit, were spread out in the crowded area where Christmas markets were taking place.

references.text: <ref name="timeline novinky" /> Multiple students walked from the evacuated Celetná building into the main building at Jan Palach Square.<ref name="Echo Pečinka" /> At 14:38, Kozák's phone was turned on and registered by a telecommunications tower located near the Old Jewish Cemetery, Prague|Old Jewish Cemetery about 100 meters from the main building.<ref name="Echo APB" /> The manhunt thus continued on the street level in this area,<ref name="idnes-final-report" /> including the Josefov|Jewish Quarter, {{Interlanguage link|Pařížská street|cs|Pařížská (Praha)}}, the Old Town Square, and Staroměstská (Prague Metro)|Staroměstská metro station.<ref name="ptydepe" /><ref name="seznam conference 09-01-2024">{{Cite news|last=Nohl|first=Radek|title=Dopisy na rozloučenou byly dva. Policie řekla novinky k vraždě 14 lidí|url=https://www.seznamzpravy.cz/clanek/domaci-kauzy-online-policie-rekne-novinky-k-zabiti-14-lidi-243237|website=Seznam Zprávy|date=9 January 2024|language=cs|access-date=9 January 2024|archive-date=9 January 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240109164051/https://www.seznamzpravy.cz/clanek/domaci-kauzy-online-policie-rekne-novinky-k-zabiti-14-lidi-243237|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name="Echo APB" /> Some plain-clothed criminal detectives moved from the Celetná building into the wider area of Jan Palach square in front of the main building. They did not enter the main building as they were informed that it had already been searched by other police units.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Syrovátková|first=Ivana|url=https://cnn.iprima.cz/nova-zjisteni-o-strelbe-na-fakulte-spis-odhalil-zasadni-rozdily-v-praci-kriminalistu-441952|title=Střelba na fakultě: Spis ukazuje nové detaily, kriminalistům zkomplikovali práci kolegové|language=cs|date=9 July 2024|website=CNN Prima News|access-date=9 July 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: A third-year history student named Tomáš Hercík has been credited with saving lives of several people during the shooting. At 14:59, one of the students present at a lecture taking place on the second floor received a message about the ongoing killing spree, prompting Hercík to head to the fourth floor. While passing by the third floor, he noticed people mingling in the corridors, seemingly unaware of the ongoing attack. Upon reaching the fourth floor, he immediately heard gunshots and people's cries. While avoiding the gunman, Hercík entered numerous classrooms and warned the people inside about the ongoing attack, making sure that they lock the doors, switch off lights, and remain quiet. He then retreated to the third floor, where he continued warning attendees in the classrooms.

sentences.text: At 14:57:28, the first phone call about the attack reached the medical emergency line. Police first received information about the attack at 14:59:06. A criminal police detective entered the building at 15:02, with uniformed policemen joining him one minute later. When police officers initially arrived, no gunshots were heard from within the building, which led the officers to move slowly towards the fourth floor in "search mode" instead of the fast "contact mode".

sentences.text: At 15:11, police officers who were searching for the gunman on the third floor were alerted that he was shooting from a rifle towards the streets outside. It was erroneously reported that the gunman was on the rooftop, when he was actually on fourth floor outside terrace. The gunfire caused panic outside the building, with crowds of people fleeing the nearby Charles Bridge. Reporter Jiří Forman who was on the ground at Jan Palach Square recorded Kozák on the fourth floor terrace with a rifle. Forman, who had taken cover, shouted at Kozák in a successful attempt to draw his fire away from students evacuating the building. The perpetrator was visible only for a few brief moments, as he kept moving out of view from those on the ground.

sentences.text: Police lost time searching for a route towards the fourth floor and then to the outer terrace, as the area is difficult to navigate. While the first three floors are accessible by the main central staircase, the position of the side staircase leading to the fourth floor was not immediately visible to the officers. Hercík eventually showed them the way to the fourth floor.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":4" /><ref name=":5" />

sentences.text: At 15:12, the advancing police forces reached the fourth floor and split into two groups; the first group continued their search for the perpetrator, while the second group began initiating first aid to the victims in the corridor.

references.text: <ref name="29 minutes" /><ref name="seznam conference 09-01-2024" /> Authorities reported seeing "piles of ammunition" inside the building's corridors, adding that Kozák had brought multiple weapons into the university.<ref name="roof" /> The city emergency services also deployed a large number of ambulance units to the scene.<ref name="f-24">{{Cite web |date=21 December 2023 |title=Gunman kills 14, wounds 25 at Prague university |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231221-prague-university-shooting-kills-10 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231222015426/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231221-prague-university-shooting-kills-10 |archive-date=22 December 2023 |access-date=22 December 2023 |publisher=France 24}}</ref>

A 32-year-old man and his two-month-old daughter were killed in Klánovice Forest on 15 December 2023. Kozák's father was killed at their home in the early morning of 21 December 2023.<ref name="bbctrail"/>

sentences.text: Fourteen people—two staff members and twelve students—died during the Charles University attack. Twelve people were instantly killed within the Faculty of Arts building, one died from their injuries at a hospital, and one died after falling from a ledge while trying to escape the perpetrator. Twenty-five people were also injured; some of them sustained injuries while jumping from the fourth floor ledge to escape the gunman. Three people were injured outside the building when the perpetrator opened fired from the building's fourth floor terrace.

references.text: <ref name=":0" /><ref name="iDNESInfo" /> Three vehicles were also hit, including two police cars.<ref name="iDNESInfo" /><ref>{{cite web |last=Davies |first=Alys |date=22 December 2023 |title='Blood all over the faculty' - eyewitnesses recount Prague attack |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67800149 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231222164210/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67800149 |archive-date=22 December 2023 |access-date=22 December 2023 |publisher=BBC news}}</ref>

sentences.text: Ten of the injured were in serious condition, Three foreign nationals were reported to be among the injured: one Dutch and two United Arab Emirates|Emiratis.<ref name="idnes-toll" />

references.text: <ref name="f-24" /> one of them being a daughter of Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic|MP and member of the parliamentary committee for education {{Interlanguage link|Jan Richter (ANO)|cs|Jan Richter (politik)}}, who criticized police for allegedly wrongly triage|triaging his daughter as a low-priority victim who subsequently nearly bled to death before reaching a hospital.<ref name="richter">{{cite news |last=Kaiserová |first=Zuzana |date=11 January 2024 |title=Obětí z fakulty je i moje dcera, málem ji nechali vykrvácet, oznámil šokovaným kolegům poslanec ANO |url=https://echo24.cz/a/Hfttf/zpravy-domov-poslanec-ano-zaskocil-obet-fakulta-dcera-nechaly-vykrvacet |work=Echo24.cz |language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text: Two of the victims were staff members, including Lenka Hlávková, head of the Institute of Musicology of Charles University, and {{ill|Jan Dlask|cs}}, a lecturer at the university's Department of Germanic Studies. The remaining fatalities were students.<ref name="mass"/>

sentences.text: On 9 January 2024, the police's Department of Internal Investigation presented the conclusion of its inquiry into police conduct in the case. The Department's director Michal Tikovský stated that they had found no mistakes in the police's handling of the case. He added that "The officers' actions were in accordance with the applicable legislation and internal regulations. The police intervention can be assessed as prompt and professional." Tikovský said that the police could not have known that the perpetrator was heading towards the main building, nor that he was preparing to carry out a mass murder. Applicable rules had also been followed when issuing the perpetrator's gun license.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.ceskenoviny.cz/zpravy/2460992 |title=Policie při zásahu na fakultě podle kontroly nechybovala, zlepšit má komunikaci |date=9 January 2024 |access-date=9 July 2024 |website=ČeskéNoviny.cz|publisher=Czech News Agency|language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Parliamentary Security Committee requested the Department's closing report. On 6 February 2024, they received a fifty-page report, in which 33 pages were completely redacted and the remaining 17 pages were mostly redacted. On page 39, it was stated that "it cannot be concluded that the police knew that the lives of the students of the Faculty of Philosophy in the building on Jana Palach Square were in real and immediate danger." Opposition ANO 2011|ANO party members were angered by the redaction of the document and stated their intent to establish a Parliamentary Inquiry Commission with full investigative powers in order to receive complete information about the case.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Gavenda |first=Jaroslav|date=6 February 2024 |title=Poslanci dostali zprávu o zásahu na fakultě. Je téměř celá začerněná |url=https://www.seznamzpravy.cz/clanek/domaci-politika-poslanci-dostali-zpravu-o-zasahu-na-fakulte-je-temer-cela-zacernena-245221|access-date=9 July 2024 |website=Seznam Zprávy|language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text:
{{rquote|right|"They were covering it up from the beginning, that no one could have expected what he would do, and that it would be just a normal suicide. I think the arsenal of weapons he had, the fact that he killed his father and planted a bomb in the house, should have led everyone to know that this was not normal."
Father of one of the victims

references.text:
<ref name="conclusion appeals" />
}}
While the Police of the Czech Republic|police intervention after the attack had started was generally accepted as correct, a strong criticism was aimed at apparent mistakes in its search for Kozák before the University attack. In January 2024, the Chief of Prague Police Petr Matějček was defending the police procedure with explanation: "''We were still working with the idea that the man was a danger to himself and was going to commit suicide.''"<ref name="police knew" /> Interior Minister Vít Rakušan also commented that authorities had no indication of anyone else at risk other than Kozák himself,<ref name="bbctrail"/> and that police knew that the father was murdered only after decommissioning the improvised explosive device, which took place after the University attack was over.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://echo24.cz/a/Hbi5P/zopoeravy-domov-vedeli-hledaji-vrah-zaznam-policie-strelba-fakulta-rakusan |title=Věděli, že hledají vraha, ukazuje záznam policie o fakultě. Ředitel Matějček dřív mluvil jinak |date=26 June 2024 |access-date=26 June 2024 |website=Echo24|publisher=Echo Media, a. s.|language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text: However, that was in contradiction with the information provided by the ''K.C.'' in the initial phone call and the murder scene within the house.

references.text: <ref name="police knew" /> According to Lidové noviny, the circumstances of the father's death were clearly pointing to murder, police also had information about Kozák's firearms possession, and Matějček personally ordered a tactical unit to be present in the Staroměstské náměstí area before the attack commenced.<ref name="police knew" /> Moreover, on 26 June 2024, online daily ''Seznam zprávy'' published action reports filed by the policemen that had unsuccessfully searched for the perpetrator in the School of Arts main building. Three policemen signed under first report wrote that they were searching for Kozák "''suspected of murdering his father''". Report of the other unit explicitly stated: "''He was suspected of murdering his father while threatening suicide. Other information suggests that he is a mentally disturbed man who also possesses several weapons.''"<ref name="pol report">{{Cite news |last1=Ciroková |first1=Kristina|last2=Valášek |first2=Lukáš|date=2024-06-12 |title=Policie věděla, že na fakultě hledá vraha. Dokládají to její vlastní záznamy |url=https://www.seznamzpravy.cz/clanek/domaci-kauzy-policie-vedela-ze-na-fakulte-hleda-vraha-dokladaji-jeji-vlastni-zaznamy-254650|access-date=2024-06-26 |website=Seznam Zprávy|language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text: During 24 June 2024, Parliamentary Security Committee hearing, Matějček further alleged that it was technically impossible for the police officers who entered the building at 13:30 to review the security camera footage at that time. The footage later revealed the perpetrator's entry at 13:23. University official labeled Matějček's statement as a "lie", claiming that reviewing of previous footage can be done immediately, but the police officers asked for it only hours after the attack. The university's information about availability of the camera footage was later confirmed also by the spokesman of the Regional Directorate of the Police of the Capital City of Prague Jan Daněk, who claimed it would in any case not be helpful, as Kozák was not facing the camera, had black hair and a different hairstyle compared to photo available to the police officers. Also, during the Committee's hearing, Matějček repeated the statement that there was no initial information that the perpetrator might commit a murder or a mass murder, but later added that he had been considered a murder suspect in relation to his father's death. Matějček admitted that the police were aware that one of his firearms was of the type which was the focus of Klánovice murders investigation. He also stated that the police sent "everything they had" into the centre of Prague.

sentences.text: General Inspection of Security Forces, which is tasked with investigating crimes of police officers, concluded its investigation at the beginning of June 2024. On 6 June 2024, its director Vít Hendrych informed members of the Parliamentary Security Committee that no crime was committed by any police officer in the case. Opposition ANO 2011|ANO members of the committee unsuccessfully requested the inspection's closing report. Hendrych stated that full fifty-page report is confidential and that even police will receive only a three-page summary. The three-page summary was released on 9 July 2024, with media noting that it does not answer any of the pertinent questions, such as what exact information police had while searching for Kozák, and especially why did the police officers leave the main building before the attack commenced.

sentences.text: Leading opposition party ANO 2011|ANO repeatedly requested establishment of Parliamentary Inquiry Commission which would investigate conduct of the police in the case. Cabinet of Petr Fiala|The governing parties repeatedly refused such a step, with head of Parliamentary Security Committee Pavel Žáček stating that they have "full trust in the police and the state attorney office". This, however, changed following the June 2024 formal conclusion of investigation and after the hearing of the Parliamentary Security Committee. First, the Czech Pirate Party broke ranks with the rest of the Government and announced it would support the opposition's vote for Inquiry Commission. On 26 June 2024, the ANO's proposal for establishment of the Commission was approved in the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic|Chamber by vote of 132 of 141 deputies. The Commission has the power to procure documents, demand explanations and interview witnesses and, depending on the nature of the case, hire an expert and an interpreter.

The 2023–24 UEFA Women's Champions League football match between SK Slavia Prague (women)|Slavia Prague and SKN St. Pölten (women)|St. Pölten, set to be played at home in Prague on the day of the shooting, was postponed. Several other sports and cultural events were also called off,

sentences.text: Authorities responded to several false alarms about potential attacks following the incident, including two bomb-related hoaxes in Prague and in Václav Havel airport. In Slovakia, a 64-year-old man in Žilina was arrested by police after calling emergency services and saying that he intended to do "what happened in Prague" on the evening after the attack. He was subsequently charged with spreading general alarm.

sentences.text: On 26 January 2024, the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic passed a new firearms act which had been in the making since 2017 and which was formally publicly introduced in September 2022. The new act, which will become effective in 2026, includes several changes, such as requiring businesses to report suspicious purchases of firearms and ammunition to police, requiring gun owners to undergo a medical examination every five years as opposed to 10 years under the current laws, giving doctors access to databases to find out if their patients are gun owners, and expanding reasons for preliminary seizure of firearms by police. The legislation passed unopposed in the lower house, and must be approved by the Czech Senate|Senate and President Petr Pavel for it to become law.

sentences.text: On 14 June 2024, the Czech police closed the investigation. The report was first provided to the relatives of the victims, and later to the general public. Investigators concluded that the shooter was a lone assailant, that the attack was not planned to target anyone in particular, and that the motive was that he felt misunderstood by society and wanted to draw attention to himself.<ref name=motive />

sentences.text: The perpetrator was identified as David Kozák (b. 12 August 1999), a 24-year-old masters in world history student from Hostouň (Kladno District)|Hostouň, {{Convert|21|km|mi|sp=us}} outside Prague, who had graduated with a bachelor's degree in History and European Studies from the Faculty of Arts. Kozák successfully defended his bachelor's thesis at the Institute of World History, Faculty of Arts, Charles University, entitled ''The Problematics of the Antagonism of the Galician Peasant Uprising of 1846|Galician Peasant Revolt and the Kraków uprising|Kraków Uprising in the Year of 1846''. The supervisor was professor {{ill|František Stellner|cs}}; the thesis was defended with an excellent grade. Kozák's thesis was subsequently awarded the Marian Szyjkowski Award by the {{Interlanguage link|Polish Institute in Prague|cs|Polský institut v Praze}}.

sentences.text: Psychiatrists in the Czech Republic have a legal duty to send their medical reports to the patient's general practitioner, "if the practitioner is known to them". As Kozák did not disclose the name of his general practitioner, no report was sent. Due to the absence of his general practitioner, Kozák's medical clearance was issued by a substitute doctor, who specialized in Chinese medicine and who graduated from Guangdong Medical University.

references.text: <ref name="idnes-final-report" /> ''Lidové noviny'', however, cited several psychiatrists, according to whom it was easy to find information about a patient's general practitioner. They claimed that it took "only three clicks" through an online communication channel with the patient's insurance provider. The {{Interlanguage link|Czech Medical Association|cs|Česká lékařská komora}} confirmed that a psychiatrist may learn about the general practitioner through this method; however there is no legal requirement to do so.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Janouš|first1=Václav|last2=Kolář|first2=Petr|title=Zbrojní průkaz vraha z fakulty mohla psychiatrička zastavit. Stačily tři kliky|url=https://www.idnes.cz/zpravy/domaci/ff-uk-strelba-zbrojni-prukaz-psychiatr-vrah.A240618_185056_domaci_stud|website=iDNES.cz|date=19 June 2024|access-date=23 June 2024|language=cs}}</ref>

<ref name="chinese doc" /> The police asked the Czech Medical Association to review whether a substitute doctor may issue a medical clearance instead of the general practitioner, as required by law.<ref name="chinese doc">{{cite web|last1=Ciroková|first1=Kristýna|last2=Valášek|first2=Lukáš|title=Razítko na zbraně dala střelci lékařka praktikující čínskou medicínu|url=https://www.seznamzpravy.cz/clanek/domaci-kauzy-razitko-na-zbrane-dala-strelci-lekarka-praktikujici-cinskou-medicinu-259030|website=Seznam Zprávy|date=9 September 2024|access-date=23 September 2024|language=cs}}</ref>

sentences.text: In November 2024, an unidentified minor female student from South Moravian Region|South Moravia was sentenced to two years imprisonment for planning to murder three other students and for expressing approval of the Prague attack. The student had first tried to gain access to firearms owned by her friends' family members, and after failing to do so, she opted to commit the attack with a kitchen knife. She was arrested on 1 January 2024, a day before she planned to commit the murders. Additionally, the court decided that after serving her prison term, the girl will be involuntarily committed into a mental institution. Her release would be conditional upon a new court decision, subject to an expert opinion that she no longer poses a threat to society.

sentences.text: During a vigil at Charles University on 22 December, its rector Milena Králíčková said, "The academic community is shaken, deeply shaken." Prime Minister Petr Fiala cancelled his scheduled events in Olomouc and travelled to Prague shortly after the shooting. President Petr Pavel expressed his "sincere condolences" to the family and friends of the victims via social media, while also cutting short a trip to France.

sentences.text: Fiala later announced a National day of mourning|day of mourning for 23 December, with flags flying at half-mast and a Moment of silence|minute of silence held at noon, along with the ringing of bells for the victims.

references.text: <ref name="bbcmotive"/><ref name="CNN" /> A mass for the victims was also held that day at Saint Vitus Cathedral, which was attended by Pavel, Senate of the Czech Republic|Senate president Miloš Vystrčil, and Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic|Chamber of Deputies president Markéta Pekarová Adamová. The service was officiated by Jan Graubner, the Roman Catholic Archbishop of Prague, who expressed shock at the incident and expressed the "need to clearly condemn what happened" while also looking into the future. University rector Milena Králíčková also said during the event that "Nobody should be left alone in these tough moments." Religious services for the victims were also held in other parts of the country.<ref name="mass">{{Cite news |last1=Janicek |first1=Karel |date=23 December 2023 |title=Czech Republic holds a national day of mourning for the victims of its worst mass killing |work=Associated Press |url=https://apnews.com/article/czech-mass-shooting-university-day-of-mourning-17c72a996a64b10215c99e9a6f3afab2 |access-date=23 December 2023 |archive-date=23 December 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231223142724/https://apnews.com/article/czech-mass-shooting-university-day-of-mourning-17c72a996a64b10215c99e9a6f3afab2 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In a social media post, Freedom and Direct Democracy|SPD MP Jiří Kobza blamed the "inclusive progressive school system" at the Faculty of Arts for creating the shooter. The post was later deleted. The {{Interlanguage link|Czech Rectors Conference|cs|Česká konference rektorů}} called Kobza's post "absolutely shocking, crossing the boundaries of decency, morality, good manners, but also the boundaries of humanity." Charles University announced it would file a criminal complaint against Kobza. On 9 January 2024, Kobza apologized on social media, claiming he was under emotions at the time of his initial post. Charles University called his apology "unsatisfactory" and too late.
